diseases.definition: Apple scab is a fungal disease that affects apple trees, causing dark, scabby lesions on leaves, fruit, and twigs.
diseases.solution: To control apple scab, use fungicides, prune infected branches, and remove fallen leaves in the autumn. Planting resistant apple varieties can also help prevent the spread of the disease.

diseases.definition: Black rot is a fungal disease that affects apples, causing black, sunken lesions on fruit, leaves, and stems.
diseases.solution: To manage black rot, practice good sanitation by removing infected plant material, use fungicides, and plant resistant apple varieties.

diseases.definition: Cedar apple rust is a fungal disease that affects apple trees, causing orange to rust-colored spots on leaves and fruit.
diseases.solution: Control cedar apple rust by pruning infected branches, removing nearby cedar trees (which act as alternate hosts), and using fungicides.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The apple tree is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The blueberry plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that affects cherry trees, causing a white powdery coating on leaves, shoots, and fruit.
diseases.solution: To control powdery mildew, prune to improve air circulation, apply fungicides, and plant resistant cherry varieties.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The cherry tree is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.disease: Corn (maize) Cercospora Leaf Spot Gray Leaf Spot
diseases.definition: Cercospora leaf spot, also known as gray leaf spot, is a fungal disease that affects corn, causing brown to gray spots with yellow halos on leaves.
diseases.solution: To manage cercospora leaf spot, rotate crops, use resistant corn varieties, and apply fungicides.

diseases.definition: Common rust is a fungal disease that affects corn, causing small, reddish-brown pustules on leaves, which may merge to form larger lesions.
diseases.solution: To control common rust, plant resistant corn varieties, practice crop rotation, and use fungicides if necessary.

diseases.definition: Northern leaf blight is a fungal disease that affects corn, causing large, tan to gray lesions with wavy margins on leaves.
diseases.solution: To manage northern leaf blight, rotate crops, till residues, use resistant corn varieties, and apply fungicides.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The corn plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Black rot is a fungal disease that affects grapes, causing brown to black lesions on leaves, shoots, and fruit.
diseases.solution: To control black rot, practice good sanitation, use fungicides, and plant resistant grape varieties.

diseases.definition: Esca, also known as black measles, is a fungal disease that affects grapevines, causing wilting, yellowing, and black streaks in the wood.
diseases.solution: Control esca by pruning affected vines, managing vine vigor, and using preventative fungicides.

diseases.definition: Isariopsis leaf spot, also known as grape leaf blight, is a fungal disease that affects grape leaves, causing small, dark spots with yellow halos.
diseases.solution: To manage grape leaf blight, practice good vineyard sanitation, use fungicides, and promote air circulation.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The grapevine is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Huanglongbing, also known as citrus greening, is a bacterial disease that affects citrus trees, causing mottled leaves, yellow shoots, and bitter, misshapen fruit.
diseases.solution: Control citrus greening by removing infected trees, controlling insect vectors, and planting disease-free citrus trees.

diseases.definition: Bacterial spot is a disease that affects peach trees, causing small, dark lesions on leaves and fruit.
diseases.solution: To manage bacterial spot, prune to improve air circulation, apply copper-based fungicides, and plant resistant peach varieties.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The peach tree is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Bacterial spot is a disease that affects bell pepper plants, causing dark lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit.
diseases.solution: To control bacterial spot, practice good sanitation, apply copper-based fungicides, and plant resistant pepper varieties.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The bell pepper plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Early blight is a fungal disease that affects potato plants, causing dark lesions with concentric rings on leaves.
diseases.solution: To manage early blight, rotate crops, space plants for good air circulation, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.definition: Late blight is a fungal disease that affects potato plants, causing dark lesions on leaves and stems, often leading to rapid defoliation.
diseases.solution: To control late blight, practice good sanitation, rotate crops, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The potato plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The raspberry plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The soybean plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease that affects squash plants, causing white powdery patches on leaves, stems, and fruit.
diseases.solution: To control powdery mildew, prune to improve air circulation, apply fungicides, and plant resistant squash varieties.

diseases.definition: Leaf scorch is a disease that affects strawberry plants, causing browning and necrosis of leaf margins.
diseases.solution: To manage leaf scorch, remove infected leaves, space plants for good air circulation, and avoid overhead irrigation.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The strawberry plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.

diseases.definition: Bacterial spot is a disease that affects tomato plants, causing dark lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit.
diseases.solution: To control bacterial spot, practice good sanitation, apply copper-based fungicides, and plant resistant tomato varieties.

diseases.definition: Early blight is a fungal disease that affects tomato plants, causing dark concentric lesions on leaves, often leading to defoliation.
diseases.solution: To manage early blight, rotate crops, space plants for good air circulation, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.definition: Late blight is a fungal disease that affects tomato plants, causing dark lesions on leaves, stems, and fruit, often leading to rapid defoliation.
diseases.solution: To control late blight, practice good sanitation, rotate crops, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.definition: Leaf mold is a fungal disease that affects tomato plants, causing yellow to brown patches on leaves, often with fuzzy growth on the underside.
diseases.solution: To manage leaf mold, prune to improve air circulation, avoid overhead irrigation, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.definition: Septoria leaf spot is a fungal disease that affects tomato plants, causing small, dark spots with yellow halos on leaves.
diseases.solution: To control septoria leaf spot, remove infected leaves, practice crop rotation, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.disease: Tomato Spider Mites Two-Spotted Spider Mite
diseases.definition: Spider mites are tiny pests that feed on tomato plants, causing stippling, webbing, and leaf yellowing.
diseases.solution: To manage spider mites, use insecticidal soaps, neem oil, or predatory mites, and maintain plant health to reduce susceptibility.

diseases.definition: Target spot is a fungal disease that affects tomato plants, causing dark, concentric lesions with a target-like appearance on leaves.
diseases.solution: To control target spot, practice good sanitation, rotate crops, and apply fungicides preventatively.

diseases.disease: Tomato Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
diseases.definition: Tomato yellow leaf curl virus is a viral disease transmitted by whiteflies that affects tomato plants, causing leaf curling, yellowing, and stunted growth.
diseases.solution: Control tomato yellow leaf curl virus by controlling whiteflies with insecticides, using virus-resistant tomato varieties, and removing infected plants.

diseases.definition: Tomato mosaic virus is a viral disease that affects tomato plants, causing mosaic patterns, leaf distortion, and reduced yield.
diseases.solution: To manage tomato mosaic virus, control aphids (vectors of the virus), remove infected plants, and plant virus-resistant tomato varieties.

diseases.definition: No disease symptoms present. The tomato plant is healthy.
diseases.solution: No action required.
